Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2008 05:38PM lburchfi wrote: I am TRYING to be optimistic...I know that I am not a statistic, but I am so sad, so mad, so upset, so confused! This has happened all so fast. Do I say anything to my 13-year-old son? Do I prepare myself for the worse? I didn't think I would have to deal with all of this at such a young age (at least I think I'm pretty young)! I am sorry to everyone who is reading this...I guess I just need to vent!
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2008 02:43PM lburchfi wrote: CalGal - What is a BRCA test? I am trying to understand all of the acronyms. By the way, thanks for your support and listing the side effects of the carboplatin/taxotere. I had AC along with Taxol back in Oct. 2003-Feb. 2004 and lost all of my hair. I guess it's a small price to pay.
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2008 09:23AM lburchfi wrote: Many thanks to all of you who have responded. I completed the carboplatin/taxotere mid-May. I had an absolute horrible time with those treatments. I was so sick! I am now on herceptin every 3 weeks and doing well. I had my ovaries removed about a month ago. While going through all of this my family and I moved back to the east coast (Delaware) so that I could be near family and friends again. I have been through A LOT recently and now I am focusing on some "me time." I will continue with my herceptin until the end of January 2009. This website has been a great place for me even though I haven't been online for a while as I have been dealing with life. MANY THANKS!
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

I would like to hear from someone who has dealt with metases to the spine...what the pain is like, symptons, etc. Thank you!
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2008 04:39PM lburchfi wrote: Well, I had another treatment today and my oncologist has sheduled me for a bone scan next Wednesday. Hopefully it's nothing right? All in my head right?
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: lburchfi wrote: Hi! I'm new to this website. In June 2003 at the age of 31 I was diagnosed with breast cancer...estrogen, progesterone, and HER2 positive. I had a right mastecomy with reconstruction and lymph node removal (only 1 node was positive). Chemo consisted of Adromycine (sp?), Cytoxin (sp?) and Taxol. Now, after 4+ years at the age of 35 the cancer has spread to the right lung. I had a right upper lobectomy on Dec. 10th and path reports shows to be the original breast cancer. In fact, one of my oncologists reports it to be oligometastatic breast cancer. After doing some online research, I found out that this is more severe than I originally thought. Perhaps I was just nieve? I figured I would just have the cancer removed, do chemo, and I would be done with it. Apparently because the cancer has spread, even after treatment I still have an 80% of recurrence! I will start chemo next Thurs. 1/31...carboplatin and taxotere every 3 weeks (6 cycles) and herceptin once a week for a year. I was really hoping to speak/chat with someone who has or is going through the same or similiar situation. Is there anyone out there that can help me? Dx 10/31/2007, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/10 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2009 11:14AM lburchfi wrote: Jan & Tania, Thank you for your responses! It is so good to be able to "vent" on this site. I had a mammo and ultrasound on Thursday and everything is A-OK! One last treatment (Herceptin) on the 29th and hopefully I'll be free and clear for a while. Thanks again! Good luck to you all!

Started chemo again beginning of 2008 including Herceptin, now finishing up Herceptin. I currently do NOT have any tumors. What are your thoughts? Thanks for listening!

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2009 06:30PM lburchfi wrote: AusAla, Thank you for the information...I certainly question my onc's thinking, but I guess I never thought twice about it until now. For the most part I've just done what my onc tells me I should do...I really need to get a handle on my care because who else will look out for me??? I do not have any heart problems. They did a MUGA 2 or 3 times over the past year (I can't quite remember...I think I have literally lost my mind!!!) but there have not been any problems that I know of. When I go in next Thursday the 29th I will discuss all of this with him. Many thanks! I've got lots of research to do! Take care!
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2009 12:05PM lburchfi wrote: Suze,  I am so sorry to hear about the pain and frustration you have been going through. My thoughts and prayers are with you as you decide what is right for you to make YOU feel better. Back in 2003 I had a right mastecomy (age 31), and decided to go with a TRAM flap. Best decision I ever made!  I never liked the idea of putting anything "foreign" into my body (i.e., implants). I try to look at the brighter side of things...I got a tummy tuck out of the deal! I don't know if this is an option for you, but I hope the suggestion helps! Take care!
Posts.Title: URGENT help needed - implant removal. Should I get both out? Suze Suze

Perhaps it was just a dream and not a warning??? HELP!!!

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2009 09:56AM lburchfi wrote: Hello All! Over the last few days I noticed that my left breast is tender...one particular spot to be exact. It's difficult to do a self exam as I had a mastecomy on the right with reconstruction. Any thoughts? All in my head again right?
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2009 05:17AM lburchfi wrote: Good question Bethie...my oncologist in Montana (I lived there the past 6 years) wanted to give it to me indefinately, but my oncologist in Delaware (where I live now) wanted to give it to me for one year (I started January 2008). I heard horror stories about people coming off of Herceptin and their cancer returning. One in particular told me it came back after 6 weeks. My DE doc says there is no reason for giving it any longer than a year...I'm a bit concerned. I see him again on the 29th for my last Herceptin and I do plan on asking him about this. I am her2+. I am not 100% comfortable with my treatment in Delaware. In fact, I have already told myself that if/when the cancer returns, I will go to another treatment center. What are your thoughts?
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2009 05:19AM lburchfi wrote: Michelle, How did your test results turn out? I pray everything went well. Keep your head up! Let me know how are you are doing. Take care.
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2008 11:57AM lburchfi wrote: Sue - I know EXACTLY how you feel. When I was first diagnosed in 2003 at the age of 31 I thought my world had ended. My son was only 9 and I was so afraid of leaving this world at such a young age, but I got through it. Then, unfortunately my cancer came back and spread to my right lung in October 2007. I am currently undergoing chemo again but somehow I have managed to get through this. You will surprise yourself at how strong you will be. Not only for yourself, but for your family as well. I didn't think I could go through it the first time, but I surprised myself and I'm going through it a second time. I'm not sure of how signficant the wait is, but I was originally told to make a decision and to do something within a month. I will keep you in my prayers. Stay strong. As everyone has told me...this too shall pass.
